where does ubuntu put openssl libraries: that's the path for non-critical ones (not critical in booting). critical ones go under /lib. man hier for more info
synaptic says i have it but it is not there, need it for doing a wpa_supplicant make
that is a list of all library files that come with package libssl0.9.7 which should contain the stuff
great! i'll give it a shot, i may need to apt-get the libopenssl then
wait a moment. did you say 'wpa_supplicant make'?
you're building some software with make, or what are you doing exactly?
yes, trying to do a make for it for the latest version
libssl0.9.7 contains the binary library files only. not the ones that you need for 'development' (like when you're building software that will use the library)
libssl-dev is the package that includes the rest stuff
excellent, off to synaptic for that!
or just write 'sudo apt-get install libssl-dev' on the command line
thanks so much, got it perfectly now!
